definition: to look in all directions (idiom)/to glance around
surname Dong
east/host (i.e. sitting on east side of guest)/landlord
surname Zhang
to open up/to spread/sheet of paper/classifier for flat objects, sheet/classifier for votes
west
the West/abbr. for Spain 西班牙[Xi1 ban1 ya2]/Spanish
full moon/to hope/to expect/to visit/to gaze (into the distance)/to look towards/towards
15th day of month (lunar calendar)/old variant of 望[wang4]

sentences.english: The old lady was standing by the roadside , looking around worriedly .
sentences.chinese: 那位老太太站在路旁，担心地东张西望。

sentences.english: What did teacher say when he saw you looking all around ?
sentences.chinese: 当老师看到你东张西望时，他会说什么呢？

sentences.english: She looked here and there, appearing to bereckoning his apartment.
sentences.chinese: 她一进门东张西望，好像在给拉瑞的房子估价。

sentences.english: This boy likes to rubber-neck in class.
sentences.chinese: 这个男孩儿上课爱东张西望。

sentences.english: There were lots of tourists rubbernecking in the street.
sentences.chinese: 许多游客在大街上伸长了脖子东张西望。

sentences.english: Don’t look down or away when chatting to your date. Ensure you keep a good eye contact.
sentences.chinese: 在聊天时不要东张西望，保持你们又眼神的交流。

sentences.english: Chueh-hui held his head, looking around. He felt relaxed in his heart.
sentences.chinese: 觉慧昂着头东张西望，心里异常轻快。

sentences.english: You don't stop or look both ways before driving through a red light.
sentences.chinese: 闯红灯时既不停下来，也不东张西望。

sentences.english: Why are those two boys looking around all the time?
sentences.chinese: 那两个男孩为何总是东张西望？

sentences.english: The little ducklings look around curiously.
sentences.chinese: 小鸭子们好奇地东张西望。

sentences.english: I don't know, I try no to look at guys' crotches when I'm catching public transport.
sentences.chinese: 不清楚，因为我在做捷运的时候从不东张西望。

sentences.english: repeated,crossing his arms and looking everywhere but at me.
sentences.chinese: 他重复说，双臂交叉，东张西望，就是不看我。

sentences.english: She looked around this way and that in a dubious manner.
sentences.chinese: 她在路上东张西望的，形迹十分可疑。

sentences.english: Seeing Tess standing at gaze he went across to her.
sentences.chinese: 看见苔丝站在那儿东张西望，他就走了过去。

sentences.english: Avoid looking around the room, tapping your fingers, or other nervous movements.
sentences.chinese: 避免东张西望或用手指敲桌子等表现紧张的举动。

definition: glancing to left and right (idiom); to look all around
to stick one's head out and look around (idiom)
to look around/to peep (through a crack)/to peer at/to throw a look at
lit. to behave like a thief/furtive/underhand
to rove around/to run around in circles/to walk back and forth
sneaky/furtive
sneaky/secretive/furtive
to shout and quarrel/to make a big fuss
to size sb up/to look sb up and down/to take the measure of/to suppose/to reckon
absent-minded/preoccupied/inattentive/with one's thoughts wandering
to swing/to sway/to wobble/to hang around/to hover around
to look around
shifty-eyed/crafty-looking (idiom)
to evade/to dodge (out of the way)
to whisper to one another's ear
to roll/to wander around/to appear repeatedly
